titleStmt.title: The Two city iuglers Tichborn, and Ireton: Being a dialogue: wherein, their rebellions, treacheries, treasons, and cheats, are fully discovered and brought to light: vvith some particular demonstrations of adhering to the Rump, and Committee of Safty [sic], to the ruine as they intended both of monarchy, city and country.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for T. Vere, with out Newgate,

notesStmt.note: Not in fact by Tichborne and Ireton, but a satire.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
